Uses of Class
graph.Graph

  • Packages that use Graph 
    Package Description
    graph
    graph package: a collection of classes for representing graphs, hyper-graphs and algorithms operating on such discrete finite structures.
    graph.coarsening
    package defines abstract classes and implements algorithms for coarsening graphs.
    graph.packing
    Optimization package that obtains near-optimal solution to the 2-packing combinatorial optimization problem.
    graph.partitioning
    Package defines interfaces and implements algorithms for graph and hyper-graph partitioning.
    utils
    utils package: containing useful classes and methods including I/O manipulation.

    • Uses of Graph in graph.partitioning

      Methods in graph.partitioning with parameters of type Graph 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] PartitionerGK.partition(Graph g, int k, java.util.Hashtable props)
      returns an array of size g.getNumNodes() with values in [1,...,k] implements the Greedy K-way partitioning scheme (simplification over F-M style algorithms since it visits nodes randomly and makes the best move iff it leads to a gain>0, in terms of cut-edges.)
      int[] PartitionerGKW.partition(Graph g, int k, java.util.Hashtable props)
      returns an array of size g.getNumNodes() with values in [1,...,k] implements the Greedy K-way partitioning scheme (simplification over F-M style algorithms since it visits nodes randomly and makes the best move iff it leads to a gain>0, in terms of weight of cut-edges.)
      int[] PartitionerGKWR.partition(Graph g, int k, java.util.Hashtable props)
      returns an array of size g.getNumNodes() with values in [1,...,k] implements the Greedy K-way partitioning scheme (simplification over F-M style algorithms since it visits nodes randomly and makes the best move iff it leads to a gain>0, in terms of weight of cut-edges.)
      int[] PartitionerIntf.partition(Graph g, int k, java.util.Hashtable properties)
      the method call will partition the graph g's nodes into k blocks.
      double CutEdgesObjFnc.value(Graph g, VectorIntf[] docs, int[] partition)
      simply return the sum of weights of the cut-edges of g in partition.
      double ObjFncIntf.value(Graph g, VectorIntf[] docs, int[] partition) 
      double[] CutEdgesObjFnc.values(Graph g, int[] partition)
      return the sum of weights of cut edges emanating from each partition
      double[] ObjFncIntf.values(Graph g, int[] partition) 

    • Uses of Graph in utils

      Methods in utils that return Graph 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Graph DataMgr.readGraphFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
      filename format is of the form: [ numnodes numarcs starta enda [weighta] [...] ] The starta, enda are in [0...num_nodes-1] weighta is double (non-negative)
      static Graph DataMgr.readGraphFromFile2(java.lang.String filename)
      filename format is of the form: [ numarcs numnodes starta enda [weighta] [...] [weight_node1...] ] The starta, enda are in [1...num_nodes] weighta is double (non-negative) node weights after arcs listing, if they exist, are double (non-negative)
      static Graph DataMgr.readGraphFromhMeTiSFile(java.lang.String filename)
      filename format is of the form: [ numarcs numnodes 1 weighta starta enda [...] ] The starta, enda are in [1...num_nodes] weighta is int (non-negative)
      static Graph DataMgr.readGraphFromhMeTiSFile(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String labelfile)
      same as above method, only that the labelfile serves to read the labels for each of the nodes in the Graph being created
      Methods in utils with parameters of type Graph 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void DataMgr.writeGraphDirectToHGRFile(Graph g, java.lang.String filename)
      write Graph in .hgr (?MeTiS) format
      static void DataMgr.writeGraphToFile(Graph g, java.lang.String filename)
      takes as input an already constructed graph, and prints it in MeTiS format in the file specified in the second argument.
      static void DataMgr.writeGraphToFile2(Graph g, java.lang.String filename)
      takes as input an already constructed graph, and prints it in MeTiS format in the file specified in the second argument.
      static void DataMgr.writeGraphToGRFile(Graph g, java.lang.String filename)
      takes as input an already constructed graph, and prints it in MeTiS format in the file specified in the second argument.
      static void DataMgr.writeGraphToHGRFile(Graph g, java.lang.String filename)
      takes as input an already constructed graph, and prints it in HMeTiS format in the file specified in the second argument.
